name: Weird problem with Kamiryn's Character Build Calculator
author: Nephylos

posts.author: Nephylos
posts.content: Hello, Gang! I got the urge to play my first paladin for NWN (persistent world) and brought up a fresh copy of Kamiryn's Character Build Calculator. So, I punched in the classes I will be using (paladin, Champion of Torm), and started to place them in the level progression column. However, when I placed Paladin in row 1, it turned red (illegal) right off the bat. It has stayed this way even after inputting my ability scores and race (human). I can take it out and start in row 2 and everything is fine, except feats are now off. I can't figure out why it says level 1 pally is illegal but is fine with every level afterward. Anyone got any ideas?

posts.author: HipRedux
posts.content: The reason you can plug it into level 2 is because a pally needs at least WIS 11 at creation just like ranger, druid and cleric.  At level 2, there are no ability requirements for any class. The only way to bypass the minimum creation abilities is to take a class that has no such prereq like fighter, rogue, monk, etc. at Level 1 before the first pally level.

posts.author: Nephylos
posts.content:
Well, this is embarrassing. I figured it out when you mentioned my Wisdom score. I put my Wis score in Int and vice- versa, so the worksheet thought my Wis was 10 and Int was 14. =P
Thanks for providing the clue! =)
